forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle rain sustains the city’s steadfast rhythm. The clouds blanket the sky, and the air hangs heavy with moisture, the low temperature lingering near 52 degrees, destined to rise slightly as dawn approaches. The likelihood of continued rain tomorrow adds a soft melancholy to the atmosphere, painting the world in muted hues. The passing wind whispers at a modest 7 mph, barely parting the curtain of gray that envelops the Golden Gate and the high rises of downtown.

Tomorrow promises a similar play of elements—rain lingers, with glimpses of sunshine daring to break through. Wisps of fog may still grace the shorelines, hinting at a marine layer that keeps the coastal landscape mysterious. As you contemplate your day, consider dressing in layers; a warm rain jacket paired with comfortable pants will serve you well against the chill. Embrace the weather with a cozy scarf and a sturdy umbrella at hand, perfect companions for an urban stroll. The atmosphere invites moments of introspection: perhaps a leisurely visit to a local café nestled on a quiet street or a wander through rain-kissed parks, where the world shimmers anew under the falling droplets. This day calls for soft conversations and the warmth of companionship, imbuing the bustling city with a tranquil charm only found on days like this.
